alert.note: Alert for East Bay Hills; East Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco Bay Shoreline (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 1:09PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A shower producing small hail and potentially torrential rain will impact portions of northwestern Alameda and southwestern Contra Costa Counties through 145 PM PDT... At 108 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a shower producing small hail over Alameda, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oakland, Berkeley, Richmond, San Leandro, Alameda, Walnut Creek, Lafayette, Albany, Orinda, Moraga, Piedmont, Emeryville, Kensington and Moraga Town. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: East Bay Hills; East Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco Bay Shoreline
